name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about South Carolina research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your South Carolina ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for South Carolina ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for South Carolina research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic South Carolina research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic South Carolina Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Learn about tips for doing South Carolina research.

    ☆ FS—Researching in South Carolina—2:06



  3. Get an overview of South Carolina research in this video.

    ☆ FS—South Carolina Overview—2:32

  4. Follow this research study for South Carolina ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step South Carolina Research, 1880-Present

  5. Ancestry: Explore resources for South Carolina research.

    ☆ AC—South Carolina Resources
    ☆ FS—The Most Overlooked Record Types in South Carolina—66:12

  6. Study the Ancestry State Guide for South Carolina research.

    ☆ AC—South Carolina State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  7. Explore online databases and sites for South Carolina research.

    ☆ TH—South Carolina Genealogy Online

  8. Record Finder: Use the South Carolina Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—South Carolina Record Finder

    9. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial South Carolina.

      ☆ AC—Colonial South Carolina


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in South Carolina in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for South Carolina

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—South Carolina African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for South Carolina.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in South Carolina in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of South Carolina
Additional Records

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about South Carolina archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about South Carolina archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about South Carolina archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: South Carolina Archives and Libraries
    ☆ South_Carolina State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for South Carolina.
  3. Explore the South Carolina Digital Library site.
  4. Explore South Carolina Dept. of Archives collection.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for South Carolina genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on South Carolina research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find South Carolina ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about South Carolina city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: South Carolina Directories

  2. Sites: Explore South Carolina city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore South Carolina city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore South Carolina ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for South Carolina city directories records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for South Carolina research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or South Carolina County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for South Carolina.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the South Carolina Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your South Carolina research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the South Carolina Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the South Carolina Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the South Carolina Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for South Carolina.
Regional/Local Societies

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about South Carolina research.
  2. Explore the South Carolina research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about South Carolina research.

choices.name: Learn about South Carolina genealogy societies.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in South Carolina in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: South Carolina Societies

  2. Explore the South Carolina Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore South Carolina genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in South Carolina.
